meanings.definition: To perform better than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The young athlete was outperforming his older competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The new computer model is outperforming the older version in speed and efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outperforming the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The student's dedication to studying was outperforming even the most diligent classmates.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outperforming the other flowers in height and beauty.

meanings.definition: To surpass in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The company's sales team is outperforming all expectations this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The talented musician is outperforming her peers in every concert.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit seemed to be outperforming the magician in tricks.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner was outperforming his own personal records with each race.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outperforming all other heroes in saving the city from disaster.
